title: RioBlemz
author: RioBlemz
content: It is no longer news that The Supreme Court of Nigeria has set Monday 23rd October 2023 for the hearing of the presidential Election cases. The question is will the Supreme court uphold justice and can the common man in Nigeria still trust the Judicial system of Nigeria?The judicial system of Nigeria has experience a lot of Judicial summersaulting where we have one constitution, similar cases but different judgement in different state.While I still ponder on so many things the Supreme Court Justices that will hear the presidential election appeal Include;1. Musa Dattijo Mohammed,2. Uwani Musa Abba Aji,3. Lawal M Garba,4. Helen M. Ogunwumiju,5. I.N. Saulawa,6. Tijjani Abubakar7. Emmanuel Agim.The first Judge will retire on 27th October! will they deliver judgement on monday? and fix a date to give their written judgement?We wait to See.

comments.author: Richbased
comments.body: Nigeria judiciary has been compromised as it's bias in judgment as the court of law that is the hope of the common has been jeopardize thereby making it difficult for people to trust the verdict of the judges. How can the judiciary that is meant to Interpret the law and punish law offenders be so loosed to bribery and corruption, they now prefer to overturn judgment to their own selfish reasons.It is sad to see that the body of government that the citizen entrust their hopes on are now the ones that are aiding lawlessness by not giving a fair verdict to judgment.If the verdict of the judiciary keeps being questioned by it citizens then I wonder the direction the country is heading to

comments.body: The supreme Court has failed longtime ago before now. In 2019 election the former president buhari didn't win the election but it was rigged and the supreme did nothing when the case brought to their table,  in the last election it was very obvious to see that the ruling party rigged the election,  even a blind man knows that the election was rigged and everyone was expecting the judiciary to do needful but to our surprise the judiciary was in support of the ruling party, everybody thought judiciary won't compromise in their judgement buy it was very . It is a very big Shane that judiciary don't have power to do right things, they allowed politicians to use them the way they want, judiciary have really lose their respect.

Like if tribunal say INEC no dey mandated to use bvas carry transmit result to irav, so why doll out money for the purpose in the first place. Well there are so many places wey we expect say supreme court suppose touch hand but if dem turn their eyes away, well as the country go be na everybody go still answer Nigerian las las.

comments.body: Me no dey too reason Nigeria's institutions because of my peace of mind. comments.author: iBaba
comments.body: Quote from: Richbased on October 20, 2023, 06:56:21 PMNigeria judiciary has been compromised as it's bias in judgment as the court of law that is the hope of the common has been jeopardize thereby making it difficult for people to trust the verdict of the judges. How can the judiciary that is meant to Interpret the law and punish law offenders be so loosed to bribery and corruption, they now prefer to overturn judgment to their own selfish reasons.While I do not totally agree with your submission that these judges are selfish and corrupt, the way the judicial system is being operated in Nigeria will make the common think the same. I have witnessed several judicial cases at the court especially when it has to do with Election Tribunal and irregularities. And I can say many of those cases came to fruition because the opponents stood firm to their grounds and had solid reasons why they claimed so. That is one thing that I feel this presidential tribunal lacks. Merit of judgment at the court because they have no enough evidences to trace the solidity of the case.QuoteIt is sad to see that the body of government that the citizen entrust their hopes on are now the ones that are aiding lawlessness by not giving a fair verdict to judgment.If the verdict of the judiciary keeps being questioned by it citizens then I wonder the direction the country is heading toThe judiciary is meant to adjudicate between the two parties between the Complaints and the Defendant. By so doing, the court is supposed to listen to both parties and resolve the dispute between them without the fear of justice and fair hearing. But whenever the court can not provide that balanced judgment, it springs in that lack of trust in the system.Sometimes, particularly, in the political arena, our cases are judged by the public wrongly due to emotional attachment to such cases and Nigerians are utterly emotional by nature and our politicians always work their ways to bank on those emotions to make their court cases. Some of the cases truly lack merit from the side of the plaintiff but due to that emotional support and public sympathy, they want the court of law to favor them inside.

This is what is killing Nigeria as a country and messing up the whole economy and political system. I think that everything will be judge in the favor of the president on seat because he is on power and have access to keep them appointments and big bribe because he is in the position to buy the judiciary and put them in his pocket. The love of money has killed the honesty, truth and uprightness in our leaders which make then to allow the wicked rich people manipulate the poor through the way that they rule and lead the citizens. Imagine how the economy is getting worst everyday by day and nothing can be done about it because the people that are suppose to stand up and oppose the government have been bribed to shut their mouths.

comments.body: Expecting much from the judicial system in Nigeria is a total ignorance on the very state of the country and those piloting the judiciary system. The last sitting of the court if appeal met with the judges sleeping during court sessions. Whether it was done intentionally or by manipulation, its purely a shame. Things are really getting out of hand and I'll not be surprised if activities repeat itself or even worse happens. For justice to prevail in this country, it would take more than just court sessions. Myself have lost confidence in the judiciary a very long time ago. Its a clearly manipulated scheme and not an independent institution that its meant to be.
